summary: This is an email chain from September 2019 forwarding documents related to a FOIA request about Jeffrey Epstein. The email discusses USMS (U.S. Marshals Service) documents that were inadvertently released and were the subject of a New York Times piece. The correspondence is between officials from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the U.S. Marshals Service.

events.title: FOIA Disclosure Discussion
events.description: A phone call and email exchange occurred regarding the disclosure of USMS documents related to Jeffrey Epstein in response to a FOIA request.

events.title: Forwarding of Inadvertently Released Documents
events.description: An email forwards previously released USMS documents concerning Jeffrey Epstein, noting they were the subject of a New York Times article.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning a FOIA request for information about Jeffrey Epstein.
It references USMS (U.S. Marshals Service) documents that were 'inadvertently released'.
The released documents were the subject of a New York Times piece that had been circulated by a press office.
The correspondence involves officials from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the U.S. Marshals Service (USMS).
Attachments include files named 'Epstein_ROls.pdf', 'Disclosure Letter.pdf', and 'Epstein_Docs.redacted.pdf'.
